fields.title: Do not let new forks inadvertently disclose repository contents
fields.body:
The fork process does not consider that the fork may have a lower access restriction than the source repository.  For example, if a *view-restricted* repository is forked, the fork will default to *push-restricted* and thus visible to anyone who has access to the Gitblit server.  Oops.

If the default fork access restriction is less than the source repository access restriction, the fork must instead default to the source repository access restriction.
